descript.abstract: The Horizon Designation Suffix table contains the designation suffix(es), one per row, for the referenced horizon. For example, the "h" and "s" of a Bhs horizon appear as two rows in this table.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

attr.attrdef: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Horizon Designation Suffix table.

One of the four kinds of symbols, that when concatenated, are used to distinguish different kinds of layers in soils. Letter suffixes are used to designate subordinate distinctions within master horizons, and layers using lowercase letters. (SSM)
The unique identifier of a record in the Horizon table. Use this column to join the Horizon Designation Suffix table to the Horizon table.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
